column12: Extended output status as text field

column2: False: Controller is not in start up mode

column1: True: Controller is currently in start up mode

column8: 0: Not applicable (only one intersection exists or applicable for all intersection of the traffic light controller)

column2: False: Traffic Light Controller in dark mode

column1: True: Traffic Light Controller not in dark mode

Manually set detector logics (1/0) as text field
Comma separated list of configured time plans. E.g. 1,2,3,5
Dynamic bands.

column1: Each dynamic band are written as pp-dd-ee where:
ee=Extension in seconds in this band
Each dynamic band is separated with a comma.

column8: Offset table

column1: Each offset time is written as pp-tt where:
Each offset time is separated with a comma

column8: Week time table. Defines time table to use for each week day

column1: Each day is written as d-t where:
Each segment is separated with a comma

column8: Time Table. Defines time tables.

column1: Each time definition is written as t-o-h-m where:
0=no plan is selected by time table
hour and minute is using local time (not UTC)
Each time definition is separated with a comma

column8: Cycle time table

column1: Each cycle time is written as pp-tt where:
Each cycle time is separated with a comma

column8: Forced input status as text field
Forced output status as text field

column4: Trigger level sensitivity for loop detector
column8: Loop detector trigger level sensitivity is written as dd-ss where:

column1: Each loop detector is separated with a comma. E.g.dd-ss,dd-ss.

column8: Manufacturer, product name and version of traffic light controller
Year according to format YYYY. NOTE: UTC is used
column12: Month (01-12) according to format MM. Note: UTC is used
column16: Day of month (01-31) according to format DD.  Note: UTC is used
column20: Hour of day (00-23) according to format DD. Note: UTC is used
column24: Minute (00-59) according to format MM. Note: UTC is used
column28: Second (00-59) according to format SS. Note: UTC is used

column8: Checksum of the traffic parameters

column1: - all signal programs, including program versions
- other device settings that are not part of the signal program
- The checksum should be calculated using the same data as used in S0098

column5: Time stamp of the checksum. Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z

column8: Traffic parameters

column1: - all signal programs, including program versions
- other device settings that are not part of the signal program
- There is no way to upload this binary file to the TLC using RSMP
- The format of the binary file is not specified and is not expected to be compatible between suppliers
column5: Time stamp of the config. Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z
column8: [text]
column9: Version information of the configuration. Contains basic information such as controller id, changes to config and other information. The format is not specified in detail

column8: Time stamp for start of measuring. Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z

column1: - Value expressed as an integer with a range of 0-65535.
- Contains data from all detector logics. Each detector logic is separated with a comma.
- The value is set to “-1” if no data could be measured (e.g. detector fault)

column8: Time stamp for start of measuring. Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z

column1: - Value expressed as an integer with a range of 0-65535.
- Contains data from all detector logics. Each detector logic is separated with a comma.
- The value is set to “-1” if no data could be measured (e.g. detector fault)

column8: Time stamp for start of measuring. Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z

column1: - Value expressed as an integer with a range of 0-100.
- Contains data from all detector logics. Each detector logic is separated with a comma.
- The value is set to “-1” if no data could be measured (e.g. detector fault)

column8: Time stamp for the minimum time for the signal group to go to green. If the signal group is green, it is the minimum time for the next green.

column1: Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z
column5: Time stamp for the maximum time for the signal group to go to green. If the signal group is green, it is the maximum time for the next green.

column1: Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z
column5: Time stamp for the most likely time for the signal group to go to green. If the signal group is green, it is the most likely time for the next green.

column1: Format according to W3C XML dateTime with a resolution of 3 decimal places. All time stamps in UTC. E.g. 2009-10-02T14:34:34.341Z
column8: [time stamp]
column9: Time stamp for the minimum time for the signal group to go to red. If the signal group is red, it is the minimum time for the next red.

column5: Time stamp for the maximum time for the signal group to go to red. If the signal group is red, it is the maximum time for the next red.

column5: Time stamp for the most likely time for the signal group to go to red. If the signal group is red, it is the most likely time for the next red.
